basics.name: Kobus van der Merwe
basics.label: Curriculum Vitae - 2025-09-22
basics.summary:
Machine Learning & Software Engineer | Freelance Consultant with over 25 years of experience designing and delivering data platforms, MLOps pipelines, and specialized software solutions across industries such as finance, automotive, consulting, and digital banking. My career is defined by building production-grade systems that seamlessly bridge research and operations, helping organizations unlock value through data and automation.

From leading 60+ engineers as a Chapter Lead in a digital bank, to designing actuarial data platforms at PwC, to driving site reliability at BMW’s IT Hub, I thrive at the intersection of data engineering, DevOps, and machine learning. My expertise spans Python, C#, Kubernetes, OpenShift, and distributed data systems, underpinned by a strong foundation in fraud detection, graph databases, and high-availability deployments.

As a consultant and founder of Marching Kubes, I have delivered bespoke analytics, GIS, and machine learning solutions. Whether architecting scalable data platforms, automating complex deployments, or mentoring teams, I approach every challenge with a focus on reliability, innovation, and impact.

Beyond my professional work, I have a keen interest in artificial intelligence, graph theory, and optimization, and enjoy exploring how advanced computing can transform industries and solve complex problems.

work.name: PwC South Africa
work.summary: Designing and implementing a data modelling platform to power bespoke actuarial and data science solutions. Responsible for architecture of data ingestion, processing, and storage components using Python, SQL, GraphQL, Kubernetes, AKS, and Azure DevOps practices. Building scalable pipelines that enable advanced analytics for clients.

work.name: BMW IT Hub South Africa
work.summary: I supported production plant connectivity by applying Site Reliability Engineering and DevOps best practices for complex, globally distributed solutions across public and private cloud infrastructure. My work centered on Kubernetes, Docker, ArgoCD, Github Workflows, and observability tooling to improve uptime, monitoring, and reliability of high-volume automotive data systems, thereby reducing production losses by minimizing downtime and enhancing system resilience.

work.name: Vision Bank
work.summary: Led the design of the bank’s enterprise data platform within the Data & Advanced Analytics team from a machine learning and data engineering perspective. I developed solutions for data ingestion, streaming, schema management, and lineage tracking. Combined Python, SQL, Kafka, and ML engineering expertise to enable robust machine learning and reporting capabilities across the bank.

work.name: Vision Bank
work.summary: As Chapter Lead, I managed over 60 engineers across multiple Spotify tribes in a digital bank startup. I guided engineering standards, improved software development and test automation, and supported both people leadership and technology direction. I drove adoption of modern practices in C#, Python, DevOps, and CI/CD, balancing line management with strategic technology research to enhance delivery velocity and system quality.

work.name: Fractal Labs
work.summary: Directed technology strategy and delivery at a data analytics provider. I led architecture and deployment of platforms using MS SQL, Kafka, MongoDB, Neo4j, MySQL, Postgres, .NET Web APIs, Python, C#, XGBoost, CUDA, Kubernetes, and OpenShift. Delivered client-facing financial analytics and fraud detection systems with strong MLOps and DevOps foundations. Fractal Labs was a continuation of MyBucks after the group restructured.
highlights: Stack: Python, C#, XGBoost, CUDA, ElasticSearch, Kafka, Neo4j, MS SQL, MongoDB, .NET Web APIs, Flask, FastAPI.

work.name: MyBucks
work.summary: At MyBucks I built high-availability OpenShift clusters and automated DevOps pipelines across 25+ projects. I developed a fraud detection system using Python and Neo4j, provisioned Kafka and ElasticSearch clusters, and led the engineering of secure and scalable machine learning platforms, enabling advanced analytics for financial services with fast time-to-market. My input delivered reduced hardware footprints while increasing hosting capacity and system resilience and improved system performance.
highlights: Designed and implemented HA Openshift clusters based on official reference architectures.
Automated OpenShift and Cloudstack cluster provisioning using Ansible for IaC.
Automated DevOps and MlOps pipelines for 25+ projects with GitOps practices.
High-availability deployments of ElasticSearch, Kafka, MongoDB, Neo4J, PostgreSQL, and MySQL.
Team Lead of an in-house fraud detector using Python and Neo4J.
Stack: Python, C#, XGBoost, CUDA, ElasticSearch, Kafka, Neo4j, MS SQL, MongoDB, .NET Web APIs, Flask, FastAPI.

work.name: Marching Kubes
work.summary: I founded Marching Kubes to deliver consulting and engineering services in data analytics, machine learning, DevOps, and GIS. I have designed OpenShift OKD architectures, automated CI/CD deployments with Kubernetes and Ansible to enable robust DevOps and MlOps practices, thereby reducing hardware footprints while increasing hosting capacity with direct cost savings. I developed custom 3D graphics and photogrammetry software for clients enabling advanced real-time visualization and analysis of geospatial data products, resulting in functional gains that boosted product sales.

MlOps, CI/CD, Docker, DevOps architecture & consultation.
Generative AI / Agentic LLM / Model Context Protocol integration and consulting, FastMCP, LangChain, LlamaIndex.
Document understanding, knowledge graphs, semantic search.
Python / .NET / Node.js software development.
Kubernetes / consulting. Public, private, and hybrid cloud environments, provisioning, and high availability.
3D graphics, photogrammetry, GIS, mapping, geospatial analysis.
Specialized software engineering services.

work.name: Various Clients
work.summary: Over nearly two decades I worked with a wide range of clients - from startups and small businesses to large financial institutions and international enterprises - building mission-critical systems and bespoke software solutions. My work spanned enterprise services, web/desktop/mobile applications, and geospatial systems, using technologies such as C#, ASP.NET, SQL Server, Oracle, Embedded C/C++, and Azure. I developed solutions in sectors including finance, insurance, manufacturing, logistics, and geospatial surveying. This period laid the foundation for my later leadership roles, sharpening my skills in C#, .NET, SQL, embedded systems, and large-scale enterprise software delivery, while exposing me to diverse industries and technical challenges.
highlights: Designing and deploying ERP, Banking, call centre integration platforms and insurance backend systems in secure financial environments.
Building 3D terrain rendering, geospatial analysis, and photogrammetry software for international clients.
Engineering integration and call-centre platforms for major banks and insurers.
Developing reverse-engineering and regression-testing tools for large SQL environments across multiple data centres.
Developed mobile logistics planning and infrastructure and asset management systems using C#, T/SQL, C/C++.
Online shop portal (UI & backend) using ASP.NET Web API, angular, MS SQL, Azure & 3rd party integrations (shipment, ID verification, bank verification).
Designed and built robust task management and scheduling software and applied it to data acquisition, database maintenance and video stream processing across multiple projects.
Bespoke ERP software development, using C#, T/SQL, Oracle, Embedded C and C++.
Stack: C#, ASP.NET, .NET, T/SQL, MS SQL, Oracle, Azure, Angular, Embedded C, C++, PowerShell, SQL SMO.
